stimulusHtml: Coherent light is incident upon a pair of slits that are separated by a small distance. The light forms an interference pattern on a screen that is directly across from the pair of slits, and the angular separation between adjacent brightness maxima in the pattern is small. The distance between adjacent brightness maxima on the screen is x. If the wavelength of the light is doubled and the distance from the slits to the screen is tripled, what would be the distance between adjacent maxima in the new interference pattern?
choicesHtml: 16x
23x
32x
6x
